content.raw:
Off the top of my head it's difficult to say why the textures aren't loading.

Here's a link to the directory structure that I finally got working:
https://bitbucket.org/complacs/crates/src/98ac1b5d757b/src/sim/?at=stable

Relevant terrain is located at ```models/hawkshead```
Relevant world is located at ```resources/worlds/hawkshead.world```

I use ROS to launch Gazebo, so the environment variables are set from within a launch file:

```
 <!-- start gazebo server-->
  <node name="client" pkg="sim" type="client" respawn="false" output="screen">
    <env name="GEOGRAPHICLIB_DATA" value="$(find sim)/resources/gis"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_MASTER_URI" value="http://localhost:11345"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_MODEL_DATABASE_URI" value="http://gazebosim.org/models"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH" value="$(find sim)/models"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH" value="/usr/local/share/gazebo-3.0:$(find sim)/resources"/>
    <env name="OGRE_RESOURCE_PATH" value="/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/OGRE-1.8.0"/>
  </node>
```

Hopefully that will help :)
content.html:
Off the top of my head it's difficult to say why the textures aren't loading.

Here's a link to the directory structure that I finally got working: https://bitbucket.org/complacs/crates/src/98ac1b5d757b/src/sim/?at=stable

Relevant terrain is located at models/hawkshead Relevant world is located at resources/worlds/hawkshead.world

I use ROS to launch Gazebo, so the environment variables are set from within a launch file:

 <!-- start gazebo server-->
  <node name="client" pkg="sim" type="client" respawn="false" output="screen">
    <env name="GEOGRAPHICLIB_DATA" value="$(find sim)/resources/gis"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_MASTER_URI" value="http://localhost:11345"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_MODEL_DATABASE_URI" value="http://gazebosim.org/models"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH" value="$(find sim)/models"/>
    <env name="GAZEBO_RESOURCE_PATH" value="/usr/local/share/gazebo-3.0:$(find sim)/resources"/>
    <env name="OGRE_RESOURCE_PATH" value="/usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/OGRE-1.8.0"/>
  </node>

Hopefully that will help :)
